children.subject: Thanks for the anecdotal advice! So if I'm going to be doing an extra semester, would option 1 or 2 be better, or are they equally okay?

(Anon from before) Well, if you get a summer internship that wants you to do 5 or 7 months/gives you that option, then option 1 for sure, unless there's a fall-only class you really want to take that last semester. I'm planning to graduate in the fall and am going to try to work ASAP in January, but if my company wants to start me later, will probably do some AP tutoring/personal projects to keep me busy. So there's that option for you. 

One downside I can think of with taking the semester off to work is that you can get kinda disconnected from Berkeley life and it's hard to get back into the swing of things (that's what I found).

OP: If I did option 1, I was think one company for the summer and a different company for the fall so I can get a better sense of what type of company/companies I want to work at full-time. Do you think that many companies start new grads in January? If so, I might consider option 2 more.

Also, valid point on getting disconnected!

I'm taking an extra semester (graduating next fall) and I don't think any companies looked down on me when I was recruiting. Being a transfer at Cal is really rough, so as long as you have a good reason why you want to stay (taking a fall- or spring-only class, staying to do more research, etc.) I'd say it's fine. In fact, you have an extra summer to get an internship, etc., which may bolster your resume.

history.content:
Hi (to both fellow students and respected professors),

I'm thinking of doing an extra semester and wanted to get your advice on how to plan it.

For context: I'm a rising senior (was a junior transfer) and will declare Data Science in the fall successfully. Also, I've taken only CS classes so far (except EE 16A), so my background so far is similar to a CS major. I want to do an extra semester to get a CS minor (just need 2 more UD CS classes), take some interesting non-CS/technical classes (i.e. IEOR, DES INV), and get involved with campus clubs/organizations (since I didn't in my 1st year here).

My main question: Should I do an internship in Fall 2019 and then do my extra/5th semester in Spring 2020 (option 1) or do my extra semester in Fall 2019 (option 2)? I'm unsure of what do because if I do option 1, will companies look down on graduating later, and even if they don't, are there any downsides to late graduation that I'm unaware of, and if so, what are they? That said, with option 2, I'm not sure if companies will start new grads in the spring semester time (do they?), and if they don't, I'd have to figure out what to do for a semester (i.e. online courses, traveling, etc) until companies start new grads in the summer/fall.

I'd really appreciate any advice on which option to go with and why. Thank you!
history.subject: Extra Semester Advice
